result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole M Peschel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample. Court WAIVES all costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, due to indigency.
48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicole M Peschel

records.addlTxt: Court waives DNA surcharge due to indegency.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.

The court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence. 

-Court WAIVES all costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge. 
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Nicole M Peschel in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant Nicole M Peschel in custody.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

As to Count 1:  Pursuant to negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Repeater enhancer DISMISSED. 

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1 as Amended:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

As to Count 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court ordered Count 1 DISMISSED.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, defendant Nicole M Peschel not in court, in custody.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for a motion hearing.  Court is in trial on another matter.  In-chambers discussions held.  Parties stipulate to vacating 5-09-2016 jury trial date and converting same date to a status conference.  Defendant to be produced.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Response to State's Motion to Limit Defendant's McMorris Evidence and Brief in Opposition to State's Other ACTS Motion, received and filed.
Attorney Leija requests an adjourned Final Pretrial/Motion Hearing date.  State does not object.  Case scheduled for Final Pretrial and Motion Hearing on 4-26-2016 at 1:30 pm in Branch 45.
filed by State:  Demand for Discovery and Inspection, Motion in Limine, Requested Jury Instructions, Witness List
State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Admit McMorris Evidence Showing the Turbulent and Violent Character of Victim, filed.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, defendant Nicole M Peschel not in court, in custody.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not produced, appearance waived.  In-chambers discussion placed on the record.  For reasons stated on the record, Court vacates jury trial date of 3-30-2016.  No objection from the state.  Defense objects.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Motion to Introduce Violent Character Evidence of the Accuser, received and filed.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, defendant Nicole M Peschel not in court, in custody.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Defendant in custody not produced, appearance waived.  Case calendared for final pretrial conference.  Defendant is not present, as she chose not to attend today's court appearance.  Court ordered case adjourned for final pretrial conference in Branch 45.  All motions are to be filed prior to the next court appearance.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, defendant Nicole M Peschel not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for final pre-trial. Defense counsel requests another final pre-trial to review the case further. State does not object. Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial in Branch 45.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, defendant Nicole M Peschel not in court, in custody.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form.  All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 45.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no alcohol.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ENJ dob 10/13/77 and all four of his children

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Nicole M Peschel in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant Nicole M Peschel in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Protasiewicz.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Wagner, Br. 38.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
